experiences.name: The Metropolitan Museum of Art
experiences.desc: World's greatest encyclopedic art museum
experiences.longDesc: Two million works spanning 5,000 years â€” from Egyptian temples to Vermeer to the rooftop garden. The Met is not a museum, it's a civilization.

experiences.name: MoMA
experiences.desc: Modern art from Starry Night to Warhol
experiences.longDesc: Starry Night, Campbell's Soup Cans, Les Demoiselles d'Avignon â€” MoMA's collection is the story of modern art, housed in a building that's a work of art itself.

experiences.name: Whitney Museum of American Art
experiences.desc: American art + Renzo Piano building, Meatpacking
experiences.longDesc: American art from Hopper to Kara Walker in Renzo Piano's stunning Meatpacking building â€” the outdoor terraces overlooking the High Line are unmissable.

experiences.name: The High Line
experiences.desc: Elevated park on former rail line, Chelsea
experiences.longDesc: An abandoned freight rail line transformed into Manhattan's most beloved park â€” 1.45 miles of gardens, art installations, and Hudson River views above the streets of Chelsea.

experiences.name: Brooklyn Bridge Walk
experiences.desc: Iconic 1883 suspension bridge, Manhattan to Brooklyn
experiences.longDesc: Walking the Gothic arches of the 1883 Brooklyn Bridge at sunset, with the Manhattan skyline behind you and Brooklyn ahead, is a New York rite of passage.

experiences.name: Central Park
experiences.desc: 843-acre urban masterpiece, Bethesda Fountain
experiences.longDesc: 843 acres of Olmsted and Vaux's masterwork â€” Bethesda Fountain, the Ramble, the Reservoir, Strawberry Fields. The green heart of Manhattan.

experiences.name: Statue of Liberty & Ellis Island
experiences.desc: America's symbol of freedom, immigration museum
experiences.longDesc: Lady Liberty and the Ellis Island immigration museum â€” 12 million people entered America through these doors. The ferry ride alone is worth it for the harbor views.

experiences.name: Broadway Show
experiences.desc: World-class theater, Times Square district
experiences.longDesc: The beating heart of American theater â€” from Hamilton to classic revivals, a Broadway show is one of those NYC experiences that lives up to every expectation.

experiences.name: Chelsea Market
experiences.desc: Food hall in former Nabisco factory, Meatpacking
experiences.longDesc: A bustling food hall in a former Nabisco factory â€” lobster rolls, Thai, tacos, artisan ice cream, and a bookshop, all under industrial brick arches.

experiences.name: Dia:Beacon
experiences.desc: Massive contemporary art museum in a factory
experiences.longDesc: A former Nabisco box-printing factory on the Hudson filled with monumental works by Serra, De Maria, Judd, and Turrell â€” art at a scale that changes how you see space.

experiences.name: Storm King Art Center
experiences.desc: 500-acre outdoor sculpture park, Hudson Valley
experiences.longDesc: 500 acres of rolling hills dotted with monumental sculptures by Calder, Serra, Goldsworthy, and more â€” America's greatest outdoor art museum.

experiences.name: Walkway Over the Hudson
experiences.desc: Longest elevated pedestrian bridge in the world
experiences.longDesc: The world's longest elevated pedestrian bridge â€” a former railroad span 212 feet above the Hudson River with views stretching to the Catskills and Shawangunks.

experiences.name: Mohonk Preserve
experiences.desc: 8,000-acre nature preserve, Shawangunk Ridge
experiences.longDesc: 8,000 acres of the Shawangunk Ridge with world-class rock climbing, 70+ miles of trails, and the dramatic white cliff faces that make the Gunks legendary.

experiences.name: Minnewaska State Park
experiences.desc: Sky lakes, waterfalls, cliff trails, Shawangunks
experiences.longDesc: Sky-blue lakes perched atop white cliffs, swimming holes, waterfalls, and miles of carriage roads through wild Shawangunk ridgeline forest.

experiences.name: Rosendale Trestle
experiences.desc: Historic railroad trestle walkway, 150 feet up
experiences.longDesc: A restored 1872 railroad trestle soaring 150 feet above the Rondout Creek â€” a short, thrilling walk with panoramic views of the Catskills and Shawangunks.

experiences.name: Golden Gate Bridge
experiences.desc: The world's most photographed bridge
experiences.longDesc: Walk or bike across the 1.7-mile Art Deco suspension bridge â€” the fog rolling through the towers is the most iconic image of San Francisco and possibly all of California.

experiences.name: Alcatraz Island
experiences.desc: Former federal prison, ferry from Fisherman's Wharf
experiences.longDesc: The Rock â€” tour the cellblocks where Al Capone and the Birdman lived, explore the gardens, and take in the shockingly beautiful views back to San Francisco.

experiences.name: Big Sur â€” Pacific Coast Highway
experiences.desc: The world's most dramatic coastal drive
experiences.longDesc: 80 miles of hairpin turns between towering redwoods and sheer Pacific cliffs â€” Bixby Bridge, McWay Falls, and the feeling that you've driven to the edge of the world.

experiences.name: Yosemite National Park
experiences.desc: Half Dome, El Capitan, waterfalls, giant sequoias
experiences.longDesc: Half Dome, El Capitan, Yosemite Falls, the Mariposa Grove of giant sequoias â€” Ansel Adams photographed it and John Muir called it a cathedral. Both were right.

experiences.name: Napa Valley Wine Tasting
experiences.desc: World-class wineries, Opus One to boutique caves
experiences.longDesc: From the grand estates of Opus One and Robert Mondavi to tiny boutique caves, Napa's 400+ wineries offer world-class cabernets in the California sunshine.

experiences.name: SFMOMA
experiences.desc: San Francisco Museum of Modern Art
experiences.longDesc: A Mario Botta-designed museum with 33,000+ works â€” the photography collection is legendary, and the living wall on the expansion is a masterpiece of green architecture.

experiences.name: South Congress Avenue (SoCo)
experiences.desc: Austin's iconic strip of shops, food, music
experiences.longDesc: Austin's soul distilled into a mile of vintage shops, boot stores, food trucks, music venues, and the neon 'I love you so much' mural that defines the city.

experiences.name: Barton Springs Pool
experiences.desc: Natural spring-fed swimming pool, 68Â°F year-round
experiences.longDesc: A 3-acre natural limestone pool fed by underground springs at a constant 68Â°F â€” Austinites have been swimming here for 10,000 years and it never gets old.

experiences.name: Live Music on 6th Street
experiences.desc: Austin's legendary live music strip
experiences.longDesc: The Live Music Capital of the World earns its name on Dirty Sixth â€” 50+ bars and venues blasting blues, country, rock, and everything in between every single night.

experiences.name: Art Deco Historic District, Miami Beach
experiences.desc: 800+ pastel Art Deco buildings on Ocean Drive
experiences.longDesc: The largest collection of Art Deco architecture in the world â€” 800+ pastel-colored buildings from the 1920s-40s along Ocean Drive and Collins Avenue.

experiences.name: Everglades National Park
experiences.desc: Subtropical wilderness, airboat tours, alligators
experiences.longDesc: 1.5 million acres of subtropical wilderness â€” airboat through sawgrass marshes, spot alligators and manatees, and explore a landscape unlike anywhere else in America.

experiences.name: Na Pali Coast, Kauai
experiences.desc: Dramatic cliffs, helicopter tours, boat snorkeling
experiences.longDesc: Kauai's impossibly dramatic 17-mile coastline of emerald cliffs and hidden beaches â€” accessible only by boat, helicopter, or the grueling Kalalau Trail.

experiences.name: John F. Kennedy International Airport
experiences.desc: Major international hub, departure point for transatlantic flights, world-class terminal amenities
experiences.longDesc: One of the world's busiest international airports serving as a gateway for transatlantic travel and premium airline services.

experiences.name: Grand Central Station Tennis Court
experiences.desc: Iconic tennis court above historic NYC landmark, unique urban sports venue
experiences.longDesc: A distinctive tennis court positioned above the iconic Grand Central Terminal, offering an extraordinary blend of sports and architectural history in the heart of Manhattan.
experiences.address: 15 Vanderbilt Ave 4th Floor, New York, NY 10017, USA

experiences.name: San Juan
experiences.desc: Vibrant Puerto Rican capital with colorful streets and Caribbean charm
experiences.longDesc: Puerto Rico's historic capital offers colorful colonial architecture, beautiful beaches, and rich cultural experiences. An injury-free travel destination.

experiences.name: Vancouver

experiences.longDesc: Vancouver steps into the global spotlight as a FIFA World Cup 2026 host city, attracting sports enthusiasts and travelers seeking dynamic urban experiences and diverse attractions.

experiences.name: Route 66
experiences.desc: Historic highway centennial, restored diners and desert landscapes, iconic American road trip
experiences.longDesc: California's legendary Route 66 reaches its 100-year milestone in 2026, drawing renewed attention to beautifully restored vintage diners and sweeping desert vistas along this iconic American corridor.

experiences.name: Serena Sauna at Serana TX

experiences.longDesc: A newly opened sauna destination offering contemporary wellness experiences and premium relaxation amenities in Texas.

experiences.longDesc: A stunning countryside region in Connecticut praised for its gorgeous landscapes and seasonal appeal as an ideal summer travel destination.

experiences.longDesc: Experience O'ahu's whale watching season with warm, surfable waves and pleasant 26Â°C beaches before summer crowds arrive.

experiences.longDesc: A tropical island destination in the Northern Mariana Islands offering pristine beaches, clear waters, and authentic Pacific island experiences.

experiences.name: Grand Teton National Park

experiences.longDesc: Discover breathtaking alpine trails with dramatic mountain peaks and stunning landscapes in this iconic American national park destination.

kidFriendly.name: American Museum of Natural History
kidFriendly.longDesc: T. rex, the blue whale, the Hayden Planetarium â€” a NYC institution where kids and adults alike lose themselves in the wonder of the natural world.

kidFriendly.name: Central Park Zoo
kidFriendly.desc: Compact zoo in Central Park, penguins & sea lions
kidFriendly.longDesc: A compact, walkable zoo right in Central Park â€” the sea lions, snow leopards, and penguin house are perfect for kids, and you're steps from the playground.

kidFriendly.name: Central Park Playgrounds
kidFriendly.desc: Heckscher, Ancient, Adventure â€” dozens of playgrounds
kidFriendly.longDesc: Central Park has 21 playgrounds â€” from the castle-themed Ancient Playground near the Met to the sprawling Heckscher. Pack snacks and let the kids run wild.

kidFriendly.name: Brooklyn Children's Museum
kidFriendly.desc: First children's museum in the world, interactive
kidFriendly.longDesc: The world's first children's museum (1899) with hands-on exhibits for kids 0-10 â€” the water play area, music studio, and world cultures exhibits are exceptional.

kidFriendly.name: Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum
kidFriendly.desc: Aircraft carrier museum, space shuttle, submarine
kidFriendly.longDesc: An aircraft carrier, a submarine, a Concorde, and the Space Shuttle Enterprise â€” all docked on the Hudson River. Kids lose their minds here (adults too).

kidFriendly.name: DUMBO Carousel (Jane's Carousel)
kidFriendly.desc: 1922 carousel in a glass box, Brooklyn Bridge views
kidFriendly.longDesc: A beautifully restored 1922 carousel spinning inside a Jean Nouvel-designed glass pavilion under the Brooklyn Bridge â€” magical at sunset.

kidFriendly.name: Top of the Rock
kidFriendly.desc: Observation deck, Rockefeller Center, Empire State views
kidFriendly.longDesc: 70 floors up at Rockefeller Center with unobstructed views of the Empire State Building, Central Park, and all of Manhattan â€” better views than the Empire State itself.

kidFriendly.name: Catamount Mountain Resort
kidFriendly.longDesc: A family-friendly mountain with skiing in winter, aerial adventures in summer, and a zip line that soars across the state border â€” Berkshires adventure for all ages.

kidFriendly.name: Legoland New York
kidFriendly.desc: Lego theme park, Goshen, Hudson Valley
kidFriendly.longDesc: 175 acres of Lego-themed rides, building workshops, and a Miniland USA built from 22 million bricks â€” a full-day destination for Lego-loving families.

kidFriendly.name: Austin Children's Museum (Thinkery)
kidFriendly.desc: Interactive STEAM museum for kids, Austin
kidFriendly.longDesc: A hands-on STEAM museum where kids build, experiment, splash, and create â€” the outdoor play area and maker space are standouts.

kidFriendly.name: San Diego Zoo
kidFriendly.longDesc: One of the world's great zoos with 3,700 animals across 100 acres of Balboa Park â€” the panda habitat, African safari, and nighttime zoo are all legendary.

kidFriendly.name: Monterey Bay Aquarium
kidFriendly.desc: World-class aquarium, sea otters, kelp forest
kidFriendly.longDesc: A world-class aquarium built on Cannery Row with a 28-foot kelp forest, sea otters, jellyfish galleries, and an open-ocean exhibit that stuns adults and kids alike.

kidFriendly.name: Barton Springs Pool (Kids)
kidFriendly.desc: Natural 68Â°F spring-fed pool, shallow end for kids
kidFriendly.longDesc: The shallow end of this natural limestone pool is perfect for little ones, and the constant 68Â°F water means it's swimmable even in Austin's blazing summers.

markets.name: Chelsea Market
markets.desc: Food hall, bakeries, artisan shops, Meatpacking
markets.longDesc: A repurposed Nabisco factory packed with artisan food vendors â€” lobster, tacos, Italian imports, craft donuts, and a bookshop under soaring brick arches.

markets.name: Smorgasburg Brooklyn
markets.longDesc: NYC's largest open-air food market with 100+ vendors on the Williamsburg waterfront â€” ramen burgers, Thai iced tea, and the Manhattan skyline as your backdrop.

markets.name: Union Square Greenmarket
markets.longDesc: NYC's premier farmers market since 1976 â€” 140+ local farms selling heirloom tomatoes, Hudson Valley cheeses, fresh-baked bread, and seasonal flowers four days a week.

markets.name: Essex Market
markets.desc: Lower East Side food hall since 1940
markets.longDesc: A Lower East Side institution since 1940 reborn in a sleek new building â€” Shopsin's, Dhamaka, Puebla Mexican, and a curated mix of old and new LES.

markets.name: Eataly NYC Flatiron
markets.desc: Mario Batali's Italian food emporium, Flatiron
markets.longDesc: A 50,000 sq ft Italian food emporium with restaurants, counters, a rooftop beer garden, and every Italian ingredient you could dream of â€” a pilgrimage for food lovers.

markets.name: Di Palo's Fine Foods
markets.desc: 1925 Italian deli, mozzarella, salumi, Little Italy
markets.longDesc: A family-run Italian deli since 1925 â€” hand-pulled mozzarella, imported salumi, aged cheeses, and a piece of old Little Italy that's still thriving.

markets.name: Russ & Daughters
markets.desc: 1914 appetizing shop, smoked fish, LES icon
markets.longDesc: Smoked salmon, whitefish salad, and cream cheese on a bialy â€” Russ & Daughters has been the gold standard of Jewish appetizing since 1914 on the Lower East Side.

markets.name: Kingston Farmers Market
markets.desc: Saturday market, local farms, Hudson Valley
markets.longDesc: A beloved Saturday morning market in Kingston's Uptown with Hudson Valley farms, artisan bread, local cheese, and the community spirit that defines the region.

markets.name: Ferry Building Marketplace
markets.desc: Iconic SF food hall, bay views, artisan vendors
markets.longDesc: San Francisco's grand 1898 Ferry Building reborn as a world-class food marketplace â€” Cowgirl Creamery, Hog Island Oysters, Blue Bottle, and bay views.

markets.name: Grand Central Market, LA
markets.desc: Downtown LA food hall, 100+ years, diverse vendors
markets.longDesc: A 100-year-old downtown LA food hall with an eclectic mix of vendors â€” egg sandwiches, Thai, pupusas, and the best counter service lunch in the city.

markets.name: Pike Place Market
markets.desc: Seattle's iconic market, fish throwing, first Starbucks
